intro: Haplophyllum dubium, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Montiniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, spreading habit with small, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its succulent leaves are adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Haplophyllum dubium is often found in sandy soils and is a component of the vegetation in coastal and inland dunes.
